intro: Monsonia longipes var. boranensis, commonly known as the Boran Mountain monsonia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers during the dry season, which are attractive to pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh, arid conditions of its habitat. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
